bitfield.description: : 1=CSI-2 v1.3 features only, 0=v2.1 features available
RX Compatibility Mode: 1=implemented
Scrambler: 1=implemented
Automotive Safety Features: 1=implemented
Number of Datatypes supported 8 or 16 only
Number of Virtual Channels supported 4 or 16 only
Internal datapath width 00: 32-bit.
Number of Stream interfaces 1, 2, or 4 only using direct encoding
Cadence D-PHY present 1 = Yes
Max Number of Lanes [1-4]
RX Compatibility Mode Active Flag. When HIGH this bit indicates that RX Compatibility Mode is enabled.
Ultra Low Power Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that Ultra Low Power mode is active.
High Speed Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that High Speed mode is active.
Frame Transmission Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that frame transmission is active.
Scrambler Active Flag. When HIGH this bit indicates that the scrambler is enabled.
Configuration Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that the CSI2TX module is in the configuration mode.
Soft Reset Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that soft reset is active.
Bypass Mode Active Flag When HIGH this bit indicates that bypass mode is active.
Pixel IF 3 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the D-PHY is not ready.
Pixel IF 3 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 3 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the D-PHY is not ready.
Pixel IF 2 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 2 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the D-PHY is not ready.
Pixel IF 1 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Line Number Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line number error occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Byte Count Mismatch Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a byte count mismatch occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Data Flow Error Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that data flow error has occurred, caused by the Frame/Line valid being asserted when the D-PHY is not ready.
Pixel IF 0 FIFO Underflow Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that at least one internal FIFO underflow occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Line End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line end occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Line Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a line start occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Frame End Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame end occurred.
Pixel IF 0 Frame Start Flag - When HIGH this bit indicates that a frame start occurred.
Pixel IF 1 Line Number Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_number_error_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Byte Count Mismatch Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the byte_count_mismatch_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Data Flow Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the data_flow_err_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 FIFO Underflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the fifo_underflow_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Line End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_en_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Line Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Frame End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_end_irq bit.
Pixel IF 1 Frame Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Line Number Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_number_error_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Byte Count Mismatch Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the byte_count_mismatch_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Data Flow Error Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the data_flow_err_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 FIFO Underflow Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the fifo_underflow_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Line End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_en_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Line Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the line_start_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Frame End Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_end_irq bit.
Pixel IF 0 Frame Start Mask - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupt generation from the frame_start_irq bit.

Interrupt Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables interrupts.

RX v1.3 Mapping Enable - Writing 1 to this bit make the TX Controller use pixel mappings for 8-bit data types which match that of the Cadence CSI-2 RX v1.3 Controller. This includes RAW8, Null, Blanking, Embedded, User Defined and Generic Long Packet data types. This bit is only available if RX_COMP_MODE is configured.
RX Compatibility Mode Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables RX Compatibility Mode.
Scrambler Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables scrambling on the ppi tx data bus.
Configuration Request - Writing 1 to this bit enables configuration mode.
Soft Reset Request - Writing 1 to this bit enables soft reset.
Bypass Mode - Enable Writing 1 to this bit enables bypass mode.
Tx clock exit time - Number of ppi_tx_word_hs_clk cycles corresponding to the HS clock exit time.
Wait Burst Time - Number of ppi_tx_word_hs_clk cycles corresponding to the inter HS burst gap.
D-PHY Reset - Active low reset for D-PHY.
D-PHY Calibration Enable. Enables calibration for D-PHY speeds over 1.5G.
D-PHY Clock Mode. Select the D-PHY Clock Lane mode 0: Continuous 1: Non Continuous
D-PHY Mode. Select the D-PHY clock mode during Non Continuous operation 00: Ultra Low Power 01: High Speed 10: Low Power Stop State 11: Reserved
D-PHY Clock Lane - Active high enable for D-PHY clock lane.
D-PHY Lane 3 Enable - Active high enable for D-PHY data lane 0.
D-PHY Lane 2 Enable - Active high enable for D-PHY data lane 0.
D-PHY Lane 1 Enable - Active high enable for D-PHY data lane 0.
D-PHY Lane 0 Enable - Active high enable for D-PHY data lane 0.
D-PHY clock lane wakeup time in ppi_tx_esc_clk cycles.
D-PHY data lane wakeup time in in ppi_tx_esc_clk cycles.
D-PHY Transmitter invert differential pair on TX Clock Lane
D-PHY Transmitter invert differential pair on TX Data Lane 3.
D-PHY Transmitter invert differential pair on TX Data Lane 2.
D-PHY Transmitter invert differential pair on TX Data Lane 1.
D-PHY Transmitter invert differential pair on TX Data Lane 0.
D-PHY Transmitter FORCE_STOP_MODE TX Data Lane 3.
D-PHY Transmitter FORCE_STOP_MODE TX Data Lane 2.
D-PHY Transmitter FORCE_STOP_MODE TX Data Lane 1.
D-PHY Transmitter FORCE_STOP_MODE TX Data Lane 0.
D-PHY Transmitter ULPS_ACTIVE_N Clock Lane Status.
D-PHY Transmitter ULPS_ACTIVE_N Data Lane 3 Status.
D-PHY Transmitter ULPS_ACTIVE_N Data Lane 2 Status.
D-PHY Transmitter ULPS_ACTIVE_N Data Lane 1 Status.
D-PHY Transmitter ULPS_ACTIVE_N Data Lane 0 Status.
D-PHY Transmitter STOP_STATE Clock Lane Status.
D-PHY Transmitter STOP_STATE Data Lane 3 Status.
D-PHY Transmitter STOP_STATE Data Lane 2 Status.
D-PHY Transmitter STOP_STATE Data Lane 1 Status.
D-PHY Transmitter STOP_STATE Data Lane 0 Status.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 0.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 0.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 1.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 1.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 2.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 2.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 3.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 3.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 4.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 4.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 5.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 5.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 6.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 6.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 7.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 7.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 8.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 8.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 9.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 9.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 10.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 10.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 11.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 11.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 12.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 12.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 13.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 13.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 14.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 14.
Max Frame Number - Maximum number of frames on Virtual Channel 15.
Frame Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables frame count on Virtual Channel 15.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0. Default ED [0x12]
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 0.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 0.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 0 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 0.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1. Default YUV422 8bit [0x1E]
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 1.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 1.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 1 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 1.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 2 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 2. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 2 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 2.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 2 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 2. Default RAW8 [0x2A]
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 2.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 2.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 2 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 2.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 2 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 2.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 3 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 3. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 3 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 3.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 3 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 3. Default RGB888 [0x24]
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 3.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 3.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 3 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 3.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 3 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 3.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 4 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 4. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 4 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 4.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 4 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 4.
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 4.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 4.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 4 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 4.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 4 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 4.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 5 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 5. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 5 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 5.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 5 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 5.
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 5.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 5.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 5 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 5.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 5 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 5.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 6 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 6. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 6 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 6.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 6 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 6.
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 6.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 6.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 6 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 6.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 6 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 6.

Packed Enable - data stream is prepacked in to 32-bit words on the pixel interface, the data is sent with the defined Data Type 7 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 7. This bit is also used for quad pixel 8-bit data types.
Extended Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 7 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 7.
Data Type - Type of data on Data Type 7 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 7.
Line Start And Line End Short Packet Generation Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables Line Start and Line End generation on Data Type 7.
Line Count Enable - Writing 1 to this bit enables line count on Data Type 7.
Bytes Per Line - Bytes per line on Data Type 7 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 7.
Max Line Number - Maximum number of lines on Data Type 7 with pixel_dt_sel[:] = 7.
Fill Level - Minimum number of packed 32 words loaded into the stream fifo before Tx will start for Stream if 0.

Stream Slave Mode suppresses frame start/end packets in stream 1. To be used when DT interleving is required in the same VC. NOTE: the stream must then be paired with stream O as the master on the StreamIF
Fill Level - Minimum number of packed 32 words loaded into the stream fifo before Tx will start for Stream if 1.
EPD enable. Set high to enable EPD operation.
EPD Short Packet Spacers: EPD Option 1: Minimum number of Spacer Bytes per Lane following a Short Packet. EPD Option 2: Fixed number of Spacer Bytes per Lane following a Short Packet.
EPD Option. 1'b0: D-PHY EPD Option 1 1'b1: D-PHY EPD Option 2
EPD Long Packet Spacers: EPD Option 1: Minimum number of Spacer Bytes per Lane following a Long Packet. EPD Option 2: Fixed number of Spacer Bytes per Lane following a Long Packet.
For LRTE EPD Option 1, this sets the minimum number of pclk cycles required to meet the D-PHY timing requirement for THS-IDLE-CLKHS0.
Debug Enable. This bit enables debug when high. If low then other DEBUG registers read 0.
